thread.title: What to drink at Saturday's third-annual Peche Fest
thread.title_full: What to drink at Saturday's third-annual Peche Fest | OregonLive.com

author: Special to The Oregonian
title: What to drink at Saturday's third-annual Peche Fest
text:
Fresh hop beers will soon be drained. Pumpkin beers can linger until Thanksgiving. But for one day this weekend, local beer fans get to fuss over brews made with a singular fruit.
On Saturday, North Portland's Saraveza will pour nearly 30 different peach beers and ciders for the third-annual Peche Fest. Most are rare, a couple have won major awards and one was at the center of a recent beer-world controversy. (And that's not even counting the one from Ex Novo Brewing called Peaches Ain't Nothing But Gose and Tricks.)
Even if you go, you probably won't be able to try them all. But there are a few that shouldn't be missed. Here's what to drink at the third-annual Peche Fest:
Elysian Brewing Company, Gourdgia on My Mind
The ink was barely dry on Anheuser-Busch InBev's takover of Seattle's Elysian Brewing Company when AB's Budweiser aired its infamous "Let them sip their pumpkin-peach ale" Super Bowl commercial. The ad was meant as a crack at craft beer swirling dilettantes in general. The only problem? Elysian actually made such a beer, a pumpkin-peach-pecan number called Gourdgia on My Mind. Peche Fest offers Portlanders a chance to try the brew, little-seen outside of Elysian's own Great Pumpkin Beer Fest. "In light of Anheuser-Busch's pointedly insulting comments about our Pumpkin Peach Ale ... we decided to omit the pecans for this batch, allowing the peach and pumpkin to take center stage without distraction," said Kevin Watson, Elysian's head brewer.
Block 15 Brewing, Turbulent Consequence: Peche
All of Block 15's beers in their Turbulent Consequence series are made in a coolship, a relatively small and shallow bin used for allowing wort (pre-fermented beer) to cool and attract airborne yeast and bacteria. Nick Arzner paid for the coolship with money he had otherwise earmarked for entering and attending the Great American Beer Festival, the beer industry's largest event. Their first entry? Turbulent Consequence: Peche, which won gold in GABF's Belgian-Style Lambic or Sour Ale category this year. "Peche is blended once a year," says Block 15 owner Nick Arzner. " I choose barrels in the late summer to add white peaches that I pick with my wife and daughter." For most, this is certainly their first and only chance to enjoy the fruits of the Arzner family's labor.
Fort George Brewery, Eat a Peach and Summer Stout
This Astoria brewery is bringing two very different beers combined by a common ingredient. From Fort George Brewery in Astoria, the Allman Brothers-inspired Eat a Peach is a 6.8% ABV kettle-soured wheat beer with a whopping 200 pounds of peaches. The acidic tang gives it a light, refreshing quality. Despite its darker color, Fort George's other entry, Summer Stout, is actually lighter in body and alcohol at 5.3% ABV. With a malt bill that includes midnight wheat and black barley giving it its darkness, it's brightened with citrusy Cascade hops and organic peaches that were added during secondary fermentation.
The complete Peche Fest 2015 lineup
Block 15 Brewing: Peche
Breakside Brewery: Abbey's Crumble
Burnside Brewing: Gin & Joose
Crooked Stave: Persica Vintage 2013
Crooked Stave: Batch #50
De Garde Brewing: Peach & Apricot Bu (bottles)
Dogfish Head: Festina Peche
Double Mountain: Peche Mode
Ecliptic Brewing/Cigar City Brewing: Ellipsing the Sun
Elysian Brewing: Gourdgia On My Mind Pumpkin Peach Ale
Epic Brewing: Brainless on Peaches
Epic Brewing: SOUR Brainless on Peaches
Ex Novo Brewing: Peaches Ain't Nothing but Gose and Tricks
Finnriver Cider: Country Peach
Fort George: Eat a Peach
Fort George: Summer Stout
Golden Valley Brewing: Brett Haven
Great Divide Brewing: Peach Grand Cru
Hi-Wheel Wine & Mead: Peach Cobbler
Hopworks/New Belgium: B-Side EP Peach Sour
Laht Neppur Brewing: Peachy Keen
Logsdon Farmhouse Ales: Peche 'n Brett
New Belgium/Hopworks: B-Side Peach IPA
New Belgium Brewing: Eric's Ale
10 Barrel Brewing (Bend): Peachalicious
10 Barrel Brewing (Portland): Du Peche Mode
13 Virtues Brewing: Peach Fuzz Pils
Upright Brewing: Fantasia
Peche Fest takes place Saturday from 3 to 10 p.m. at Saraveza, 1004 N. Killingsworth, and its side bar, the Bad Habit Room, 5433 N. Michigan Ave. Tickets are $10 and include a glass and two drink tickets. Peach-flavored foods and cocktails will be served. For tickets, click here.
-- Brian Yaeger
